knimeNode.name: Single sample t-test
knimeNode.shortDescription: The single sample t-test tests the null hypothesis that the population mean is equal to a given number.

fullDescription.intro: Computes statistics for the single sample t-test. The single sample t-test tests the null hypothesis that the population mean is equal to a given number.
fullDescription.option: The hypothesized value to test against.
The limits for the confidence interval are computed using this number. The default is 95 which means that you can be 95% confident that the true value of the parameter is in the confidence interval.
A two sample t-test is performed separately for each of these columns.

ports.outPort: Statistics for the one sample t-test.

views.view: Tables with descriptive statistics of the input columns and test statistics of the single sample t-test.
